name: read_file_contents
description: Read the contents of a file and return text, JSON, JSONL, or tabular data. Supports .txt, .json, .jsonl, .csv, .xls, .xlsx, .pdf formats and images(.jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .bmp), with optional slicing by row/line and optional column filtering. You can use the slicing parameter to read truncated files. You can use the slicing parameter to browse a truncated document in parts. This allows you to progressively read the full content without being limited by length constraints.

file_path.description: The full path of the file to be read.

start.description: The starting row (.xlsx, .xls, .jsonl, .csv, .txt, .pdf) or object (.json) index for reading the file. Default is 0.

end.description: The ending row (.xlsx, .xls, .jsonl, .csv, .txt, .pdf) or object (.json) index for reading the file. Default is None, meaning read till the end.

column_names.description: List of columns to include (only valid for CSV or Excel files). If empty, includes all columns.

sheet_name.description: Name of the Excel sheet to read (only for Excel files). Leave empty to read the first sheet.
